title: Multimodal Learning for Cardiac Health Assessment
author: Radiant Group
excerpt: Combining medical images and structured signals to assess cardiac health.
content:
## Context
Cardiac assessment relies on multiple complementary signals.

## Problem Statement
Unimodal models fail to capture clinical complexity.

## Design Principles
- Representation fusion
- Interpretability-first

## System Overview
Visual and numerical features are fused at representation level.

## Evaluation
Explainability and confidence calibration are mandatory.

## Limitations
Data alignment remains challenging.

## Lessons Learned
Multimodality improves robustness.

## Conclusion
Clinical intelligence is inherently multimodal.
